issue.title: Deployment option #3 fails

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Deploy option #1 works, but option #3on `docker-compose up`.

I suspect this line ` /usr/bin/env: 'bash\r': No such file or directory` causing the issue. 

I'm familiar with Dockerfile, but still green on docker-compose; apologies that I can't help debug.

issue.title: Couldn't Access to Django Admin Page

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

How to reproduce the problem
---------
<!-- Include the details of how the problem occurred. Which option did you choose to install doccano? Did you come across an error? What else did you try? -->

I installed using docker method. 
I want to create users for annotators.
I followed [https://djangobook.com/mdj2-django-admin/](https://djangobook.com/mdj2-django-admin/) and created a superuser `python manage.py createsuperuser`
I still could not access to admin page by `XXXX:8000/admin`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11748629/105440458-8c674400-5ca1-11eb-8440-18a8f7ab0825.png)

I wonder if I should restart the doccano app. 
But I did not find a way. 
(btw, restarting the docker container does not work!)

```bash
# copy-paste the error message here
```

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Linux version 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64 (builder@kbuilder.dev.centos.org) (gcc version 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16) (GCC) ) #1 SMP Tue Aug 22 21:09:27 UTC 2017
*   Python Version Used: -
*   When you install doccano: 2021.01.16
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): 
```
docker pull doccano/doccano
docker container create --name doccano \
  -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" \
  -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com" \
  -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" \
  -p 8000:8000 doccano/doccano
docker container start doccano
```

issue.title: How to approve/reject user annotation?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Hi, thanks for a great annotation tool.

I have one question, searching throung existing isues dont help me.
I have a project type **Sequence to sequence** have one user role Annotator and one as Annotation Approver.
When i'm login with Annotation Approver user account, it's seem everything like Annotator account. There's nothing to approve/reject an annotation.
- User manager page:
![Screenshot from 2021-04-27 10-19-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12376486/116179835-32639800-a742-11eb-87a2-a2e85c2755a4.png)

- Annotation page for Annotation Approver user:
![Screenshot from 2021-04-27 10-20-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12376486/116179852-368fb580-a742-11eb-908f-30a2e9aecc2b.png)

* OS: Linux doccano-9846dcd8c-nqq7h 3.10.0-957.27.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Jul 29 17:46:05 UTC 2019 x86_64 GNU/Linux
* Python Version Used: 3.8.6
* When you install doccano: One week ago

issue.title: Fixing Data Annotation Issues

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
When uploading datasets, the code uses a `bulk_create` to upload
Examples and Labels. It then filters the data from the database
based on when it was created. However, [Django doesn't enforce
the list order when calling filter](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7163640/what-is-the-default-order-of-a-list-returned-from-a-django-filter-call) unless ordering is specified. The previous behavior mismatched labels
and examples. When this was shown in the UI, the data would show labels
for incorrect examples (i.e. a label for message #2 would be shown on
message #1). This fix enforces that the data is returned in the order
it was inserted so that the data, label pair is as expected. This was slightly hard to detect as the ordering returned from Postgres/Django was variable and would sometimes return the expected results but other times not.

issue.title: Failed to create new label. (Recently)

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
It's impossible to create or modify Label. (I can create labels by uploading a file)

Here is backend server (Django) log.
